snippet: Facebook’s stock rose even though 800 million shares became eligible for trading on Wednesday, the third and largest of a series of lockups that have expired since the company made its debut on the public market, Somini Sengupta writes in the Bits...
abstract: Facebook’s stock rose even though 800 million shares became eligible for trading on Wednesday, the third and largest of a series of lockups that have expired since the company made its debut on the public market, Somini Sengupta writes in the Bits blog of The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Facebook’s stock rose even though 800 million shares became eligible for trading on Wednesday, the third and largest of a series of lockups that have expired since the company made its debut on the public market, Somini Sengupta writes in the Bits blog of The New York Times.
